sentence.Network_en: In the one photo in which she appeared, Hillary Clinton wore a magenta gown.
sentence.Network_cn: 在其中一张照片中，希拉里身着一件紫红色礼服。

sentence.Network_en: For the same reason air information is printed in magenta.
sentence.Network_cn: 出于同样的原因,航空资料采用品红色印刷.

sentence.Network_en: One tuft was of two colours, magenta and brick - red, apparently growing on the same root.
sentence.Network_cn: 有一簇有洋红跟砖红俩颜色, 两种颜色的花, 显然是从同一个根上长出来.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 19th cent.: named after Magenta in northern Italy, site of a battle (1859) fought shortly before the dye (of blood-like colour) was discovered

entry.def: Magenta is used to describe things that are dark reddish-purple in colour.

means.word_mean: 1. a dark purple-red; the dye was discovered in 1859, the year of the battle of Magenta
